thread.title: 19 drivers who won during Ryan Newman's winless streak
thread.title_full: 19 drivers who won during Ryan Newman's winless streak

title: 19 drivers who won during Ryan Newman's winless streak
text:
Mar 21, 2017 at 3:05p ET 0Shares Getty Images Getty Images 
Ryan Newman snapped a 127-race winless streak with a stunning victory in Sunday’s Camping World 500 at Phoenix Raceway. 
During that long span, 19 different drivers won Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series races. 
Check out who rolled into Victory Lane and how many victories they racked up during Newman’s dry spell. Getty Images Getty Images Jamie McMurray, 1 win 
McMurray is going through his own winless streak. His last victory came in the 2013 fall race at Talladega. © Russell LaBounty/LAT Photo USA Russell LaBounty Aric Almirola, 1 
Almirola put the No. 43 Richard Petty Motorsports Ford in Victory Lane in a rain-shortened Coke Zero 400 at Daytona. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images AJ Allmendinger, 1 
The road-course ace won his only Monster Energy Series race in August 2014 at Watkins Glen. Getty Images Getty Images Tony Stewart, 1 
Stewart scored his 49 th and final Cup victory at Sonoma in July 2016 before retiring from full-time racing. Getty Images Sean Gardner Kyle Larson, 1 
Larson beat out Chase Elliott to earn his first career Monster Energy Series win at Michigan in August 2016. Getty Images Getty Images Chris Buescher, 1 
Buescher was in the right place at the right time when the skies opened up at Pocono in August 2016. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Kasey Kahne, 2 
Another driver suffering through a winless streak, Kahne’s last victory was at Atlanta in 2014. Kurt Busch, 5 
Of the five times Busch won, his 2017 Daytona 500 triumph tops them all. WPPROD Jeff Gordon, 6 
The four-time Cup champion and FOX NASCAR analyst scored his final win in the fall race at Martinsville in 2015 in his last full-time season. Getty Images Getty Images 
Winning both the Coca-Cola 600 and Southern 500 in 2016 highlights Truex’s six victories. MCT MCT via Getty Images Dale Earnhardt Jr., 7 
Earnhardt has broken into Victory Lane on seven occasions since Newman’s Indy win, including the 2014 Daytona 500. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Denny Hamlin, 7 
The marquee victory of Hamlin’s seven wins was the 2016 Daytona 500, beating Truex by 0.010 seconds. Getty Images Getty Images Carl Edwards, 8 
The 2016 fall race at Texas could have very well been Edwards’ final Cup victory after walking away from NASCAR racing before the 2017 season. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Matt Kenseth, 10 
This is number is impressive considering Kenseth was winless during the 2014 season. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Kyle Busch, 12 
Rowdy also earned the 2015 champion after missing a good portion of the season due to a broken leg. , LAT Images www.latphoto.co.uk Lesley Ann Miller Brad Keselowski, 13 
Keselowski recorded 13 victories at nine different track over the course of Newman’s winless streak. Kevin Harvick, 14 
Among Harvick’s 14 wins included the 2014 season finale at Homestead which led to winning his first championship. ©, Michael L. Levitt ©2015, Michael L. Levitt Joey Logano, 15 
Logano’s 2015 Daytona 500 victory is the most prestigious of his 15 wins. Jimmie Johnson, 16 
No surprise here. Along with 16 wins, the seven-time champion also earned two titles during Newman’s 127-race streak in 2013 and 2016.
